data.title: How Green Was My Valley, Signed
data.meta_description: How Green Was My Valley: The Screenplay for the John Ford Film by Dunne, Philip and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine dj. First Trade Edition. [a beautiful copy, with no discernible wear to either book or jacket, although the jacket does have an infinitesimal nick at the bottom edge of the rear panel (now protected and concealed by a new mylar jacket cover, such that you'd never have noticed it if I hadn't mentioned it)]. (B&W photographs) SIGNED by the author on the front endpaper. The screenplay for the Academy Award-winning 1941 film, "accompanied by Mr. Dunne's own sharply observed and evocative essay on the film's making and aftermath." The trade edition was limited to 1000 copies; also issued were an additional 250 copies of a special edition, signed by both Dunne and Roddy McDowall (whose portrait photo of Dunne appears on the rear jacket panel). Signed by Author.

First edition LIMITED to only 1000 trade copies, SIGNED by Oscar nominated screenwriter Philip Dunne. With numerous black and white illustrations being either stills taken from the film or photographs taken during its production. Small 4to, in the publisher's original gray wove cloth, lettered on the spine in gilt, and in the original dustjacket of green paper featuring a pictorial scene of a Welsh mining town on the upper cover and a portrait of Philip Dunne on the rear taken by Roddy McDowall. 105pp. A very fine copy, as mint. SIGNED BY THE OSCAR NOMINATED SCREENWRITER AND A LIMITED FIRST EDITION of the script for this extraordinary motion picture published in conjunction with the film's admittance into the National Film Registry as a National Treasure. In the year 1941, Twentieth Century-Fox released 43 feature films, among them Blood and Sand, Swamp Water, Sun Valley Serenade, two Charlie Chan mysteries, and a Laurel and Hardy comedy. Towering above all of these was the most honored film of the year, an extraordinary adaptation of Richard Llewellyn's best selling novel of life in a Welsh mining community. Produced by Darryl F. Zanuck and directed by John Ford, HOW GREEN WAS MY VALLEY became the recipient of five Academy Awardsincluding the coveted awards for Best Director and Best Picture; a huge accomplishment in the same year as The Maltese Falcon, The Little Foxes, and CITIZEN KANE.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine dj. Limited Edition. [a very nice copy, with the slightest bit of foxing to the top of the text block; the jacket is flawless except for a couple of faint scrape marks on the rear panel]. (B&W photographs) This is the limited special edition (250 copies) SIGNED by both Philip Dunne and Roddy McDowall. The screenplay for the Academy Award-winning 1941 film, "accompanied by Mr. Dunne's own sharply observed and evocative essay on the film's making and aftermath." (McDowall, in addition to having starred in the film, took the photograph of Dunne that appears on the rear jacket panel.) Signed by Associated.

First Edition. One of 250 deluxe numbered copies signed by the author, Philip Dunne and actor Roddy McDowall, the star of the film. As new in an as new dust jacket. Printed on acid-free paper and bound in full linen cloth. As new in dust jacket. The shooting script for the highly acclaimed John Ford film with a long essay by Dunne about the writing of the film and working with Ford. Illustrated.
